intro: Galium subvelutinum subsp. delicatulum, commonly known as the delicate bedstraw, is a low-growing herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in clusters during the summer months. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its delicate appearance and preference for specific habitats make it a notable species in ecological studies.
